newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian govt open to talk on Telstra.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian govt open to talk on Telstra.

text.p: Australian Treasurer and Acting Prime Minister Peter Costello said on Wednesday the government was happy to talk with Labor defector Senator Colston on the proposed partial sale of telecommunications carrier Telstra Corp.

"If he wants to say to the government that I'm worried about these particular principles and if we can accommodate them within the context of a responsible project we are quite happy to talk," Costello told Melbourne radio 3AW.
"If senator Colston has a legitimate point we'll certainly address it, within the framework of making sure it's overall responsible," the treasurer said.
The government's plans to sell one-third of Telstra for about A$8 billion depend on legislation authorising the sale passing the upper house of parliament, the Senate.

Since ruling Liberal-National coalition is two votes short of a majority in the Senate and all non-government parties are opposed to the sale, the government is hoping for the support of the two Independents, Colston and Brian Harradine.
